title: Domain Suspension Guidelines
content: Domains may be suspended due to inaccurate WHOIS info or policy violations. To reactivate, update your WHOIS details and contact support.
ref: Domain Suspension Guidelines - Reasons for Suspension (#doc_001)

title: Domain Renewal and Expiry
content: After a domain expires, most registries provide a 30-day grace period to renew. If not renewed, it may enter redemption with higher fees.
ref: Domain Renewal and Expiry - Renewal Grace Period (#doc_002)

title: DNS Configuration Troubleshooting
content: DNS propagation can take up to 48 hours globally. If your website isn't loading, verify your A records point to the correct IP address and nameservers are responding.
ref: DNS Configuration Troubleshooting - Common DNS Issues (#doc_003)

title: Domain Transfer Authorization
content: To transfer a domain, ensure it's unlocked, obtain the EPP/Auth code, and verify the domain hasn't been transferred or registered within the last 60 days.

title: WHOIS Privacy Protection
content: Privacy protection masks personal information in WHOIS databases. This service can be enabled/disabled through your domain provider, though some TLDs don't support privacy.

title: Email Forwarding Setup
content: Set up email forwarding by creating MX records pointing to your provider's mail servers. Configure catch-all forwarding or specific address redirections through your DNS panel.

title: Domain Lock Status
content: Domain lock prevents unauthorized transfers. While locked, transfer requests will be denied. Contact your provider to unlock when planning legitimate transfers.

title: Redemption Period Recovery
content: Domains in redemption can only be recovered by the original owner within 30 days. Recovery fees are typically $100-200 above standard renewal costs.
ref: Redemption Period Recovery - Expired Domain Recovery (#doc_008)

title: Subdomain Management
content: Create subdomains by adding A, CNAME, or other DNS records with the subdomain prefix. Examples: 'www' for www.example.com or 'mail' for mail.example.com.

title: SSL Certificate Integration
content: SSL certificates encrypt data between browsers and servers. Install certificates through your hosting panel or use DNS validation for domain-validated certificates.

title: Nameserver Changes
content: Update nameservers to point your domain to different hosting providers. Changes typically propagate within 24-48 hours but can take up to 72 hours globally.

title: Domain Parking Services
content: Park unused domains to display ads and generate revenue. Parking services provide templates and handle ad placement, splitting revenue with domain owners.

title: ICANN Transfer Policy
content: ICANN requires registrars to process legitimate transfer requests within 5 days. Transfers can be denied for valid reasons like domain locks or invalid auth codes.

title: Bulk Domain Management
content: Manage multiple domains efficiently using bulk update tools for nameservers, contacts, and renewals. Most providers offer CSV import/export for large portfolios.

title: Domain Auction Participation
content: When domains aren't renewed after redemption, they may go to auction. Register with auction platforms and verify funds before bidding on expired domains.
ref: Domain Auction Participation - Expired Domain Auctions (#doc_015)

title: International Domain Extensions
content: Country code TLDs (ccTLDs) like .uk, .de, .jp have specific registration requirements including residency restrictions or local presence requirements.

title: Domain Dispute Resolution
content: Trademark disputes can be resolved through UDRP (Uniform Domain-Name Dispute-Resolution Policy). File complaints with approved providers like WIPO for cybersquatting cases.

title: Auto-Renewal Configuration
content: Enable auto-renewal to prevent accidental domain expiration. Ensure payment methods are current and consider setting up renewal notifications 60 days before expiry.

title: Registry Maintenance Windows
content: Registry maintenance may temporarily affect domain modifications. Most registries schedule maintenance during low-traffic hours and provide advance notice.

title: Domain History and Backorders
content: Research domain history using archive tools before purchasing. Place backorders for expiring domains you want to acquire when they become available.
ref: Domain History and Backorders - Acquisition Strategies (#doc_020)
